item.title: AI for Stroke Outcome Prediction
item.description:
Role: Postdoctoral Researcher at Inria in AIstroSight team

Collaborators : Dr. Metchouff â€“ Physician at Hospices Civils de Lyon (HCL)

Scientific and Technological Objectives

The early inflammatory response after an acute ischemic stroke (AIS) plays a crucial role in patient recovery. This research aims to:

  • Identify immune system signatures in patients experiencing loss of autonomy post-thrombectomy.
  • Analyze gender-based recovery differences to improve personalized stroke care.

Research Approach

1. Statistical & Graphical Analysis for Clinical Interpretation

  • Replicated key statistical from a prior study (originally focused on age) to examine gender differences in stroke recovery.
  • Applied Subgroup Discovery on biomarkers to identify patient-specific risk intervals.
  • Developed a manual interpretation framework with clear thresholds, similar to standard blood test markers, enabling physicians to make quick prognoses without requiring computational tools.

2. Machine Learning for Predicting Loss of Autonomy

  • Expanded the dataset to include medical history, MRI report descriptions and additional features.
  • Implemented supervised learning models to predict functional outcomes post-stroke.
  • Assessed explainability techniques (SHAP, LIME, counterfactual) to:
    • Identify gender impact in stroke recovery predictions.
    • Evaluate the consistency of different explanation methods for medical decision-making.

Dissemination and Publications

Public Science Communication

item.title: Introduction to Machine Learning
item.description:
“Introduction Ã  lâ€™Apprentissage Automatique” (IAA)

Promotion: 1st year of engineering (ING1) (35 students) Year: 2022-2023
Institution: EPITA Lyon
Hours: 8h CM, 2h TD, 2h TP
Responsibilities: Created lectures, tutorials, practical sessions, and assessments.
Description: Covered supervised (classification, regression) and unsupervised (clustering) learning and model evaluation. Grading was based on a project, a written article published on Pop’Sciences and a final exam.

item.title: Data Mining
item.description:
“Data Mining” (INF2355M)

Promotion: M2 Data Science (60 students in TD & TP)
Year: 2021-2022 Institution: Univ. Lyon 1 DÃ©partement d’Informatique
Hours: 8h TD, 6h TP
Responsibilities: Designed a project combining TD and TP.
Description: Students worked in groups to develop a data mining tool, using an academic paper and Git repository to create tutorials and summaries for future research applications.

item.title: Knowledge Discovery in Data
item.description:
“DÃ©couverte de connaissances dans les donnÃ©es” (INF2418M)

Promotion: M2 Information Technologies and Web (TIW) & M2 Bioinformatics (50 students)
Year: 2021-2022 Institution: Univ. Lyon 1 DÃ©partement d’Informatique
Hours: 2h CM, 2h TP
Responsibilities: Created and delivered lectures and practical sessions.
Description: The lecture introduced machine learning, while the practical session was a tutorial on Natural Language Processing (NLP). Used interactive tools like Wooclap for in-class engagement.
